revisionDesc.change: moved notes to external notes file and added pts
Duke proofreading corrections and minor note corrections.
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Moved RMBucke to HandNote; fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Proofread and corrected, annotated letter date confirmation and added RM Bucke, added note on revising Leaves in early February 1868.
corrected date format in title; added call no., annotations

body.p:
i have just got your letter i thought it was a goner but it has come all safe with the 2 doller dollars i got the letter of last thursday Thursday Walter and the one i neglected to speak of of some time ago of a friday Friday so i have not missed any the last weeks week's one i liked its giving a description of how you spent your time) and i got the franklyn almanackFranklin Almanack but i have not got the papers you spoke off of to day but probably shall get them to morrow the carrier seems very Obliging i gave him the 50 cts cents for new year and last week i gave him 25 cts cents as he had brought me a number of books and the almanac its a real good one much better than the tribune one so i think i will make out for almanacks almanacs this year mary hasent hasn't come yet the weather has been very bad indeed so i think she could not have got here last sunday Sunday was awfull Edd went to church but had sence sense enoughf enough to come home before dark he fell twice but only wet him it dident didn't hurt him i see in the eagle monday Monday there was 7 women all down at once in orange st sunday Sunday night came from Beechers Beecher's church it was very bad indeed toward evening who should come here but Emma pricePrice she said she come out from the clouds she came from mrs Wells sMrs. Wells's but she
had a pretty bad time of it she missed her way and got way up to mrs blacksMrs. Black's so when she got here it was almost night she had on rubber boots but had gone over the tops in water so she took it off and dried her feet and had to go back she said mrs wells Mrs. Wells would be uneasy about her if she dident didn't go back) i felt uneasy very after she went and i see how very bad it was but i suppose she got safe as i have not heard any thing her mother is not as well as she has been has spells of her old complaint

i have had two letters from Matt since the one i sent to you the first she seemed quite homesick the next she is quite contented they have got a house at last from the 1 of march March 7 rooms for 65 dolle dollars per month had to take it for two years or not have it matt says Jeff
is glad they come he is very tired of hotell hotel life this house is out of the thick part of the city matt says the children is very much pleased the boarders makes very much of sis she tells them all about her grandma and her uncles she says they think the water dont don't agree with them in the morning when they first get up they often all vomit at once she is very carefull careful about their diet she says) George is to camden Camden yet i dont think he will be home till the last of the month i went down Walt and got the money order cashed in a day or two after i recieved received it) i am feeling as well as usual) O i like to forgot matt says they got your letter and was so glad that you must write as often as you can and she will write to you so no more at present Walter dear) so your you're writing again leaves of grassLeaves of Grass well if it dont don't hurt you i am glad
